content:
Diagnosis:	Bilateral lung squamous cell carcinoma, Stage IV

Management:	2023 Oct - Commenced pembrolizumab/carboplatin/paclitaxel
		2024 Jan - Changed to docetaxel due to disease progression
		2024 Mar - Commenced alpelisib following PIK3CA mutation detection

Histology:	Poorly differentiated squamous cell carcinoma, PD-L1 35%

Current Situation:	Progressive disease with deteriorating performance status

I reviewed [redacted name] today who has unfortunately experienced further clinical deterioration. Despite third-line treatment with alpelisib, there has been progression of disease with worsening breathlessness and new onset right-sided chest pain. Performance status has declined to ECOG 3, spending most of the day in bed or chair. Oxygen requirements have increased to 4L/min at rest.

Recent CT chest/abdomen/pelvis (15 Apr 2024) shows increase in size of bilateral lung masses, new pleural effusions, and progression of bone metastases with new T4 vertebral body involvement. Brain MRI shows new small brain metastases.

Given the deteriorating clinical picture and poor performance status, I have had a detailed discussion with [redacted name] and family about focusing on symptom control. We have agreed to discontinue alpelisib and refer to palliative care. I have prescribed dexamethasone 4mg twice daily for symptomatic brain metastases and arranged urgent palliative radiotherapy assessment for the T4 vertebral metastasis.

I have made an urgent referral to the community palliative care team and hospital palliative care service. [redacted name] will be reviewed by palliative care team tomorrow, and I will review again in one week to ensure adequate symptom control.
